CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: In the solid state , the planarity effect and interchain stacking of PffBB-n caused the bathochromic shift of the absorption cut - off to ∼ 780 nm , corresponding to a narrow optical band gap of ∼ 1.61 eV. Density functional theory ( DFT ) calculations was carried out to probe the molecular and electronic properties of the PffBB-n polymer by means of B3LYP / 6-311+(d,p) as a basis set in a vacuum using the repeating conjugated units of the polymer backbone in which all of the alkyl substitutions were replaced by ethyl groups to reduce the calculation time. Figure 2 displays the optimized molecular conformation and the frontier molecular orbitals of the ethyl-substituted repeating units of PffBB-n. The dihedral angle between the BDT electron - donating unit and the electron - deficient unit was found to be ∼ 26.9 ° in the optimized structure , which is caused by the ethyl substitution on the thienyl ring. The HOMO delocalizes extensively over the π-conjugation framework , whereas the LUMO mainly populated on the benzothiadiazole Article unit. Such frontier molecular orbital electron distribution would greatly enhance efficient intramolecular charge transfer. The electrochemical properties of PffBB-n were determined by cyclic voltammetry. Their results are summarized in Table 2 , and the respective energy levels are delineated in Figure 2d. The HOMO energy levels of PffBB-10 , PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 were estimated from the onset oxidation potential to be -5.66 , -5.73 , -5.72 , and -5.78 eV , respectively. The corresponding LUMO energy levels were calculated from the HOMO energy level and the onset absorption of polymers in thin films , which were -4.01 , -4.11 , -4.11 , and -4.16 eV , respectively. As a result , the HOMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers are much lower than that of ITO and their corresponding LUMO energy levels of PffBB-n lied slightly above that of PC71BM. Such energy level alignment would facilitate charge transfer from the donor polymer to the PC71BM acceptor and provide a relatively large difference between the HOMO energy level of donor polymers and the LUMO level of PC71BM , which is important to achieve a large V oc of a solar device. As a result , BHJ PSCs fabricated from these polymers are promising to achieve high device performance. X-Ray Diffraction ( XRD ). X-ray diffraction measurements were carried out to determine the crystallinity of PffBB-n polymers and the XRD spectra are shown in Figure 3. Despite various sizes of alkyl side chains attached , polymers with the same backbone show very similar XRD patterns. The sharp peaks at around 5 ° correspond to the in-plane spacing ( d 1spacing ) between the polymer backbones , whereas the broad peaks lying above 20 ° ( d 2 -spacing ) is characterized as a π-π stacking distance.

Let's think step by step.

1. PffBB-n: This is the name of the polymer under discussion.
2. B3LYP / 6-311+(d,p): This is the name of the density functional theory (DFT) method and basis set used in the calculations.
3. ethyl-substituted repeating units of PffBB-n: This refers to the specific substitution of alkyl groups in the PffBB-n polymer.
4. BDT electron-donating unit and electron-deficient unit: These are specific functional groups in the PffBB-n polymer.
5. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) and LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital): These are electronic states in the PffBB-n polymer.
6. ITO and PC71BM: These are other materials mentioned in the context of energy level alignment for solar devices.
7. PffBB-10, PffBB-12, PffBB-14, and PffBB-16: These are specific polymers within the PffBB-n series.
8. XRD (X-ray Diffraction): This is a technique used to determine the crystallinity of PffBB-n polymers.
9. d 1-spacing and d 2-spacing: These are specific distances in the XRD patterns of PffBB-n polymers.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PffBB-n
2. ethyl-substituted repeating units of PffBB-n
3. ITO
4. PC71BM
5. PffBB-10, PffBB-12, PffBB-14, and PffBB-16

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PffBB-n |
| ethyl-substituted repeating units of PffBB-n |
| ITO |
| PC71BM |
| PffBB-10 |
| PffBB-12 |
| PffBB-14 |
| PffBB-16 |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: In the solid state , the planarity effect and interchain stacking of PffBB-n caused the bathochromic shift of the absorption cut - off to ∼ 780 nm , corresponding to a narrow optical band gap of ∼ 1.61 eV. Density functional theory ( DFT ) calculations was carried out to probe the molecular and electronic properties of the PffBB-n polymer by means of B3LYP / 6-311+(d,p) as a basis set in a vacuum using the repeating conjugated units of the polymer backbone in which all of the alkyl substitutions were replaced by ethyl groups to reduce the calculation time. Figure 2 displays the optimized molecular conformation and the frontier molecular orbitals of the ethyl-substituted repeating units of PffBB-n. The dihedral angle between the BDT electron - donating unit and the electron - deficient unit was found to be ∼ 26.9 ° in the optimized structure , which is caused by the ethyl substitution on the thienyl ring. The HOMO delocalizes extensively over the π-conjugation framework , whereas the LUMO mainly populated on the benzothiadiazole Article unit. Such frontier molecular orbital electron distribution would greatly enhance efficient intramolecular charge transfer. The electrochemical properties of PffBB-n were determined by cyclic voltammetry. Their results are summarized in Table 2 , and the respective energy levels are delineated in Figure 2d. The HOMO energy levels of PffBB-10 , PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 were estimated from the onset oxidation potential to be -5.66 , -5.73 , -5.72 , and -5.78 eV , respectively. The corresponding LUMO energy levels were calculated from the HOMO energy level and the onset absorption of polymers in thin films , which were -4.01 , -4.11 , -4.11 , and -4.16 eV , respectively. As a result , the HOMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers are much lower than that of ITO and their corresponding LUMO energy levels of PffBB-n lied slightly above that of PC71BM. Such energy level alignment would facilitate charge transfer from the donor polymer to the PC71BM acceptor and provide a relatively large difference between the HOMO energy level of donor polymers and the LUMO level of PC71BM , which is important to achieve a large V oc of a solar device. As a result , BHJ PSCs fabricated from these polymers are promising to achieve high device performance. X-Ray Diffraction ( XRD ). X-ray diffraction measurements were carried out to determine the crystallinity of PffBB-n polymers and the XRD spectra are shown in Figure 3. Despite various sizes of alkyl side chains attached , polymers with the same backbone show very similar XRD patterns. The sharp peaks at around 5 ° correspond to the in-plane spacing ( d 1spacing ) between the polymer backbones , whereas the broad peaks lying above 20 ° ( d 2 -spacing ) is characterized as a π-π stacking distance.

Let's think step by step.

1. Absorption cut-off: The wavelength at which the absorption of a material begins. In this case, it's shifted to approximately 780 nm.
2. Optical band gap: The energy difference between the valence band and the conduction band in a material, which determines the range of energies that photons can excite electrons. In this case, it's approximately 1.61 eV.
3. Density functional theory (DFT): A computational quantum mechanical modeling method used to investigate the electronic structure of a material.
4. B3LYP: A specific exchange-correlation functional used in DFT calculations.
5. Basis set: A set of mathematical functions used to approximate the wave functions of atoms in a molecule. In this case, it's 6-311+(d,p).
6. Repeating units of the polymer backbone: The structural repeating units of the PffBB-n polymer.
7. Alkyl substitutions: The ethyl groups attached to the polymer backbone to reduce calculation time.
8. Dihedral angle: The angle between two planes that are rotated with respect to each other. In this case, it's the angle between the BDT electron-donating unit and the electron-deficient unit.
9. Frontier molecular orbitals: The highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) of a molecule.
10. Ethyl-substituted repeating units of PffBB-n: The optimized molecular structure of the PffBB-n polymer with ethyl substitutions.
11. HOMO energy levels: The energy levels of the highest occupied molecular orbitals of PffBB-10, PffBB-12, PffBB-14, and PffBB-16.
12. LUMO energy levels: The energy levels of the lowest unoccupied molecular orbitals of PffBB-10, PffBB-12, PffBB-14, and PffBB-16.
13. ITO: Indium tin oxide, a common transparent conductive oxide used in optoelectronics.
14. PC71BM: A fullerene derivative used as an acceptor material in organic photovoltaics.
15. Voc: Open-circuit voltage, a measure of the maximum voltage that a photovoltaic cell can produce under illumination.
16. XRD: X-ray diffraction, a technique used to determine the crystalline structure of materials.
17. Crystallinity: The degree to which a material is in a crystalline state.
18. XRD patterns: The diffraction patterns obtained from X-ray diffraction measurements.
19. In-plane spacing (d1-spacing): The distance between the polymer backbones in the plane of the crystal.
20. π-π stacking distance (d2-spacing): The distance between the planes of π-conjugated systems in a crystal.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. Optical band gap: Approximately 1.61 eV
2. HOMO energy levels: -5.66 eV (PffBB-10), -5.73 eV (PffBB-12), -5.72 eV (PffBB-14), -5.78 eV (PffBB-16)
3. LUMO energy levels: -4.01 eV (PffBB-10), -4.11 eV (PffBB-12, PffBB-14), -4.16 eV (PffBB-16)
4. HOMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers: Much lower than that of ITO
5. LUMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers: Slightly above that of PC71BM
6. Crystallinity: N/A (not a property of a material, but rather a characteristic of the material's structure)
7. In-plane spacing (d1-spacing): The distance between the polymer backbones in the plane of the crystal
8. π-π stacking distance (d2-spacing): The distance between the planes of π-conjugated systems in a crystal.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Optical band gap |
| HOMO energy levels of PffBB-10, PffBB-12, PffBB-14, PffBB-16 |
| LUMO energy levels of PffBB-10, PffBB-12, PffBB-14, PffBB-16 |
| HOMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers (compared to ITO) |
| LUMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers (compared to PC71BM) |
| In-plane spacing (d1-spacing) |
| π-π stacking distance (d2-spacing) |

Paragraph: In the solid state , the planarity effect and interchain stacking of PffBB-n caused the bathochromic shift of the absorption cut - off to ∼ 780 nm , corresponding to a narrow optical band gap of ∼ 1.61 eV. The HOMO delocalizes extensively over the π-conjugation framework , whereas the LUMO mainly populated on the benzothiadiazole Article unit. Such frontier molecular orbital electron distribution would greatly enhance efficient intramolecular charge transfer. The electrochemical properties of PffBB-n were determined by cyclic voltammetry. The HOMO energy levels of PffBB-10 , PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 were estimated from the onset oxidation potential to be -5.66 , -5.73 , -5.72 , and -5.78 eV , respectively. The corresponding LUMO energy levels were calculated from the HOMO energy level and the onset absorption of polymers in thin films , which were -4.01 , -4.11 , -4.11 , and -4.16 eV , respectively. As a result , the HOMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers are much lower than that of ITO and their corresponding LUMO energy levels of PffBB-n lied slightly above that of PC71BM. Such energy level alignment would facilitate charge transfer from the donor polymer to the PC71BM acceptor and provide a relatively large difference between the HOMO energy level of donor polymers and the LUMO level of PC71BM , which is important to achieve a large V oc of a solar device. As a result , BHJ PSCs fabricated from these polymers are promising to achieve high device performance. X-Ray Diffraction ( XRD ). X-ray diffraction measurements were carried out to determine the crystallinity of PffBB-n polymers and the XRD spectra are shown in Figure 3. Despite various sizes of alkyl side chains attached , polymers with the same backbone show very similar XRD patterns. The sharp peaks at around 5 ° correspond to the in-plane spacing ( d 1spacing ) between the polymer backbones , whereas the broad peaks lying above 20 ° ( d 2 -spacing ) is characterized as a π-π stacking distance.

Let's think step by step.

1. Bathochromic shift of absorption cut-off: ∼ 780 nm (wavelength) or ∼ 1.61 eV (energy)
2. Dihedral angle between BDT electron-donating unit and electron-deficient unit: ∼ 26.9 °
3. HOMO energy levels of PffBB-10, PffBB-12, PffBB-14, and PffBB-16: -5.66, -5.73, -5.72, and -5.78 eV, respectively
4. LUMO energy levels of PffBB-10, PffBB-12, PffBB-14, and PffBB-16: -4.01, -4.11, -4.11, and -4.16 eV, respectively
5. HOMO energy level of ITO: N/A
6. LUMO energy level of PC71BM: N/A
7. In-plane spacing (d1-spacing) between the polymer backbones: around 5 ° (angle)
8. π-π stacking distance (d2-spacing): N/A (not explicitly stated in the text, but can be inferred as a distance)

Note: The energy values are given in electron volts (eV).
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Bathochromic shift of absorption cut-off: ∼ 780 nm (wavelength) or ∼ 1.61 eV (energy)
2. Dihedral angle: ∼ 26.9 °
3. HOMO energy levels: -5.78 eV (PffBB-16)
4. LUMO energy levels: -4.16 eV (PffBB-16)
5. In-plane spacing (d1-spacing): around 5 ° (angle)
6. π-π stacking distance (d2-spacing): N/A (distance)

Note: The energy values are given in electron volts (eV). The specific values for HOMO and LUMO energy levels for PffBB-10, PffBB-12, and PffBB-14 are not mentioned in the text, so they are not included in the list.
